H0.text: Binoculars are what the student should use, in addition to a bird identification book, to find out how many different kinds of birds are found in a park.

H1.text: Goggles should be used by the student, in addition to a bird identification book, to find out how many different kinds of birds are found in a park.

H2.text: A microscope should be used by the student in addition to a bird identification book to find out how many different kinds of birds are found in a park.

H3.text: A hand lens is used by the student in addition to a bird identification book to determine how many different kinds of birds are found in a park.

A4.text: Birdwatching is a very popular hobby among nature and animal lovers; a binocular is their most basic tool because most human eyes cannot resolve sufficient detail to fully appreciate and/or study small birds.

A5.text: A larger (e.g. 40–45mm) objective works better in low light and for seeing into foliage, but also makes for a heavier binocular than a 30–35mm objective.
